Understate: The claim may understate the impact of the tax levy freeze on property taxes for residents in Westchester County.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or data to support the assertion that the tax levy has remained flat for seven straight years.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for the decrease in county property taxes, such as population growth and the spreading out of the tax levy among more taxpayers.
Contradict fact: The claim contradicts the fact that the property tax levy has remained the same at $548 million annually, rather than being reduced to zero.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the tax levy freeze is solely responsible for the decrease in county property taxes, without considering other factors that may contribute to the overall tax bill.
